<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Committee also approved metrics for the 2011 One Hershey Incentive Program and approved a change to the weighting of the three financial metrics in
the program. The financial performance metrics and weighting for the 2011 One Hershey Incentive Program are: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">50% based on consolidated net sales, increased from 40% in 2010; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:2px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">40% based on adjusted earnings per share-diluted; and </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:2px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">10% based on operating cash flow, decreased from 20% in 2010. Operating cash flow is defined as the average of cash from operations less pension
contributions and commodities hedging transactions, measured in five 12-month periods ending on December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2010, April&nbsp;3,&nbsp;2011, July&nbsp;3,&nbsp;2011, October&nbsp;2,&nbsp;2011 and December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2011.
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Committee approved a change in the weighting of metrics within the One Hershey Incentive Program to place increased
emphasis upon net sales growth in 2011. The One Hershey Incentive Program targets for 2011 are centered around the Company&#146;s publicly-announced financial expectations for 2011 of net sales growth and adjusted earnings per share-diluted growth
that will </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">58 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">
be around the top of our long-term objectives of 3% to 5% and 6% to 8%, respectively, and operating cash flow generated by performance consistent with these expectations. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Committee approved a design for the One Hershey Incentive Program for 2011 consistent with 2010. For executive officers, including Mr.&nbsp;West, the
weighting of Company financial performance metrics will account for 75% of their target award under the One Hershey Incentive Program. The remaining 25% of the target award will be based upon achievement of individual SBGs. The Committee recommended
and the independent directors approved the change to the structure of Mr.&nbsp;West&#146;s 2011 short-term incentive target award from being based entirely upon the achievement of Company financial results to having 75% of his target award based
upon Company financial results and 25% of his target award based upon individual SBGs. The Committee recommended and the Board approved this change to tie more directly achievement of his individual SBGs to the determination of his One Hershey
Incentive Program award as is the case for our other executive officers. The Committee approved continued inclusion of a values modifier in the One Hershey Incentive Program award calculations for executive officers, excluding Mr.&nbsp;West. One
Hershey Incentive Program award payments for 2011, if any, will be decreased by 10% for the executive officers reporting to Mr.&nbsp;West who do not demonstrate the Hershey Values. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B></B>The Committee and the independent directors (in the case of Mr. West) have each retained discretion under the 2011 One Hershey Incentive Program to increase or decrease the results achieved on the
basis of Company financial metrics (75% of the named executive officers&#146; target awards) by up to 30% based upon their respective assessment of the quality of financial results achieved. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In February&nbsp;2011, the Committee approved contingent target awards of PSUs under the Incentive Plan for the 2011-2013 performance cycle for the executive officers with the exception of Mr.&nbsp;West.
In February&nbsp;2011, the independent directors as a group approved the Committee&#146;s recommendation for a contingent target award of PSUs for the 2011-2013 performance cycle for Mr.&nbsp;West of 36,550 PSUs, which equals the target level of
163% of his 2011 base salary. The contingent target PSU awards for Mr.&nbsp;West and all of the executive officers represent approximately 50% of the value of their long-term incentive grant. Metrics approved by the Committee for the 2011-2013
performance cycle are consistent with those of the 2010-2012 performance cycle: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Three-year relative TSR versus the financial peer group (50% of the target award); </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:2px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Three-year compound annual growth in adjusted earnings per share-diluted measured against an internal target (12.5% of the target award); and
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:2px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Annual growth in adjusted earnings per share-diluted measured against an internal target for each year of the three-year performance cycle (12.5% of
the target award per year). </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The metrics approved by the Committee for TSR provide target-level awards for achieving
performance at the median of the financial peer group. Targets for our three-year and 2011 annual growth rate in adjusted earnings per share-diluted are in line with our publicly-announced financial expectations. Payment, if any, for awards will be
made in shares of the Company&#146;s Common Stock at the conclusion of the three-year performance cycle. The Committee will approve the targets for the annual adjusted earnings per share-diluted metrics at the beginning of each of the three years in
the performance cycle. The annual setting of targets for a portion of the performance cycle award payment provides a stronger link between performance and payout in </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">59 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">
that the Committee can set performance targets for a portion of the award that reflect current business conditions at the start of each year. The maximum award for any participant in the
2011-2013 performance cycle is 250% of the contingent target award. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In February&nbsp;2011, the Committee approved stock option awards for the
executive officers other than Mr.&nbsp;West representing approximately 50% of their individual long-term incentive targets. In February&nbsp;2011, the independent directors as a group approved the Committee&#146;s recommendation for a 2011 stock
option award for Mr.&nbsp;West with a value, using the Black-Scholes option-pricing model, of $1.7&nbsp;million which equals the target level of 162% of his base salary. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Were there any other changes since year end 2010 affecting executive compensation? </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Based
upon the recommendation of the Committee, the Board approved amendments to the EBPP&nbsp;3A, applicable to the Company&#146;s executive officers, effective as of February&nbsp;22,&nbsp;2011. As discussed above, EBPP&nbsp;3A assists the Company in
attracting and retaining qualified executives by making provisions for the protection of covered executives in connection with a change in control of the Company or termination of employment under certain circumstances outside the context of a
change in control. The amendments to EBPP&nbsp;3A more closely align the provisions of EBPP&nbsp;3A with those existing in similar plans at companies in our peer group and emerging best practices. The amendments approved by the Board: </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Eliminate the excise tax gross-up in the event of a change in control for all covered executives (except Mr.&nbsp;West, for whom such benefits are
required under his employment agreement); </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:2px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Reduce, for new entrants into the plan, the period on which severance benefits will be calculated upon a non-change in control termination from 24
months to 18 months; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:2px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Change the definition of change in control by raising to 30% from 25% the threshold for an acquisition of stock by a third party to trigger a change in
control; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:2px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Provide that a change in control will occur only at the closing of a merger or sale transaction and not at stockholder approval of such a transaction;
and </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:2px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Adopt an amended definition of cause to apply to terminations of employment in and outside of the context of a change in control.
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>In what other ways do we align the interests of executive officers with the interests of stockholders? </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Company believes that requiring executive officers to hold significant amounts of our Common Stock strengthens the alignment of the executive
officers with the interest of stockholders and promotes achievement of long-term business objectives. We have had executive stock ownership requirements for well over 20 years. The ownership requirements were most recently modified in 2008 based
upon external market comparisons provided by Mercer. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Elected and appointed officers are required to accumulate the minimum number of shares
to meet their stock ownership level within five years of their initial election or appointment to their position. For purposes of this requirement, &#147;shares&#148; include shares of our Common Stock that are owned by the officer, unvested
time-based RSUs, PSUs earned for the annual segments of open performance cycles, as well as vested RSUs and PSUs that have been deferred by the officer as common stock units under our Deferred Compensation Plan. Currently, minimum stockholding
requirements for executive and appointed officers range from one to five times base salary, as described in the table below. The dollar value of shares which must be acquired and held equals a
</FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">60 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">
multiple of the individual executive&#146;s base salary. The number of shares to be held is updated whenever a change in base salary occurs. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TR BGCOLOR="#e5e5e5">
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8px"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">CFO and other Executive Officers
(excluding the Chief Accounting Officer)</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8px"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Chief
Accounting Officer and Other Appointed Officers subject to stockholding requirements</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="center" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-right:8px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1 times base salary</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Failure to reach the minimum within the five-year period results in a notification letter to the executive, with a copy to the CEO, and a requirement
that future stock option exercises and PSU payments be settled by retaining at least 50% of the shares of Common Stock received until the minimum ownership level is reached. The Committee receives an annual summary of each individual officer&#146;s
ownership status to monitor compliance. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">As of February&nbsp;28,&nbsp;2011, the record date for the annual meeting, the value of shares owned
by Mr.&nbsp;West totaled approximately eight times his base salary. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><A NAME="toc144369_16"></A>Compensation Committee
Report </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>To Our Stockholders: </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">We have reviewed and discussed with management the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, beginning on page&nbsp;42. Based on that review and discussion, we have recommended to the Board of Directors that
the Compensation Discussion and Analysis be included in this proxy statement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Submitted by the Compensation and Executive Organization
Committee of the Board of Directors: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:54%; text-indent:-2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Robert&nbsp;F. Cavanaugh, Chair </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:54%; text-indent:-2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Pamela&nbsp;M. Arway </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:54%; text-indent:-2%"><FONT

Committee Report with respect to the approval of Mr.&nbsp;West&#146;s compensation. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:54%; text-indent:-2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Charles&nbsp;A. Davis

 <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><A NAME="toc144369_17"></A>Summary Compensation Table </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The following table and accompanying footnotes provide information regarding compensation earned, held by, or paid to, individuals holding the positions
of Chief (Principal) Executive Officer and Chief (Principal) Financial Officer throughout 2010, the three most highly compensated of our other executive officers who served throughout the year and one additional executive officer who separated from
service during the year, but whose compensation was among the highest of those who served as executive officers during 2010. We refer to these six executive officers as our named executive officers. In accordance with SEC rules, the following table
provides information with respect to 2010, 2009 and 2008 compensation if reported in our prior years&#146; proxy statements. Ms.&nbsp;Binder was not a named executive officer in the Company&#146;s 2010 or 2009 proxy statements; therefore,
information on her 2009 or 2008 compensation is not included. Mr.&nbsp;O&#146;Day was not a named executive officer in the Company&#146;s 2009 proxy statement; therefore, information on his 2008 compensation is not included. </FONT></P>

 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">62 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">(3)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">Column&nbsp;(e)&nbsp;includes the dollar value of contingent target PSU awards at their grant date fair value. The number and grant date fair value of performance stock
units, or PSUs, awarded each named executive officer for the 2010-2012 performance cycle appear in Columns&nbsp;(g)&nbsp;and (l)&nbsp;of the Grants of Plan-Based Awards table. Assuming the highest level of performance is achieved for each of the PSU
awards included in Column&nbsp;(e) the value of the awards at grant date for each of the named executive officers would be as follows: </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">Ms.&nbsp;Binder&#146;s last day of active employment with the Company was September&nbsp;10,&nbsp;2010. As a result, Ms.&nbsp;Binder forfeited all of her outstanding
PSU awards including those shown in Column&nbsp;(e) of the 2010 Summary Compensation Table. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">Column&nbsp;(e) also includes the grant date fair value of RSU awards granted in the years indicated. The unvested portion of these RSU awards is included in the
amounts presented in Columns&nbsp;(g)&nbsp;and&nbsp;(h) of the Outstanding Equity Awards table on page&nbsp;68. The number of shares acquired and value received by the named executive officers with respect to RSU awards that vested in 2010 is
included in Columns&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;and&nbsp;(e) of the Option Exercises and Stock Vested table on page&nbsp;70. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">(4)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">Column&nbsp;(f)&nbsp;presents the grant date fair value of stock options awarded the executive for the years indicated and does not reflect the value of shares actually
received or which may be received in the future with respect to such stock options. The assumptions we made to determine the value of these awards are set forth in Note 17 to the Company&#146;s Consolidated Financial Statements included in our 2010
Annual Report to Stockholders that accompanies this proxy statement. The number and grant date fair value of stock options awarded to each named executive officer during 2010 appears in Columns (j)&nbsp;and (l)&nbsp;of the Grants of Plan-Based
Awards table. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">(5)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">As discussed in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis and as shown in Column&nbsp;(g), the Committee determined that payments would be awarded under our annual
incentive program, which we refer to as the One Hershey Incentive Program, to the named executive officers for 2010. Awards under the One Hershey Incentive Program for 2010 are based on pay received in 2010. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">(6)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">Column&nbsp;(h)&nbsp;reflects the change in the actuarial present value of the named executive officer&#146;s pension benefit under the Company&#146;s tax-qualified
pension plan, the Compensation Limit Replacement Plan, or CLRP, and the DB&nbsp;SERP, from the pension plan measurement date used in preparing the 2009 audited financial statements to the pension plan measurement date used in preparing the 2010
audited financial statements, determined using the interest rate and mortality rate assumptions consistent with those used in our 2010 audited financial statements. Messrs.&nbsp;Alfonso and O&#146;Day do not participate in the DB&nbsp;SERP, as they
participate in the DC&nbsp;SERP, a plan authorized under the Company&#146;s Deferred Compensation Plan. DC&nbsp;SERP contributions for Messrs.&nbsp;Alfonso and O&#146;Day are included in Column&nbsp;(i) as listed in footnote 7 below. Ms.&nbsp;Binder
also did not participate in the DB&nbsp;SERP but participated in the Company&#146;s DC&nbsp;SERP. However no 2010 DC&nbsp;SERP contribution was made on her behalf and, as a result of her termination, she forfeited her entire DC&nbsp;SERP account
balance. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">The named executive officers also participate in our non-qualified Deferred Compensation Plan under which amounts deferred are credited with
&#147;earnings&#148; based on the performance of one or more third-party investment options available to all participants in our 401(k) Plan. No portion of the &#147;earnings&#148; credited during 2010 was &#147;above market&#148; or
&#147;preferential.&#148; Consequently, no Deferred Compensation Plan earnings are included in amounts reported in </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">63 </FONT></P>

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">
Column&nbsp;(h)&nbsp;above. See the Pension Benefits table on page&nbsp;73 and the Non-Qualified Deferred Compensation table on page&nbsp;75 for more information on the benefits payable under the
qualified pension plan, DB&nbsp;SERP and Deferred Compensation Plan to the named executive officers. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">Amounts shown for personal use of the Company aircraft were computed on the basis of the incremental expense incurred by the Company for the flights.
</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">(8)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">In addition to Supplemental 401(k) match attributable to 2008, the 2008 Supplemental 401(k) match amount for Mr.&nbsp;West includes a Company contribution made in
April&nbsp;2008 to reflect a portion of the 2007 Company match that was forfeited as a result of the 401(k) Plan non-discrimination testing. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">(9)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">As discussed in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, Ms.&nbsp;Binder&#146;s employment with the Company terminated on September&nbsp;10,&nbsp;2010. In connection
with her termination, Ms.&nbsp;Binder received a cash payment of $824,000 under the terms of the Company&#146;s Executive Benefits Protection Plan (Group 3A), or EBPP 3A. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">(10)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">As are all new hires since January&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2007, Mr.&nbsp;O&#146;Day is eligible to receive a contribution to his 401(k) Plan account equal to 3% of base salary up
to the maximum amount permitted by the Internal Revenue Service, or IRS. We call this contribution the Core Retirement Contribution. He also is eligible to receive a Supplemental Core Retirement Contribution of 3% of base salary in excess of the IRS
limit. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>

to each PSU, stock option and RSU awarded to each named executive officer during 2010. The amounts that were earned under the One Hershey Incentive Program during 2010 by the named executive officers are set forth in Column&nbsp;(g) of the Summary
Compensation Table. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><A NAME="toc144369_18"></A>Grants of Plan-Based Awards </B></FONT></P>

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">(2)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">Except for Mr.&nbsp;Bilbrey, the amounts shown in Columns&nbsp;(c),&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;and&nbsp;(e) represent the threshold, target and maximum potential amounts that might
have been payable based on the One Hershey Incentive Program targets, including the possible 30% adjustment to financial scores, approved for the named executive officers in February&nbsp;2010, based on pay received in 2010. For Mr.&nbsp;Bilbrey,
the amounts shown in Columns&nbsp;(c),&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;and&nbsp;(e) represent the threshold, target and maximum potential amounts that might have been payable based on the One Hershey Incentive Program target approved in February&nbsp;2010 and the
target approved in November&nbsp;2010, concurrent with his promotion to Chief Operating Officer, including the possible 30% adjustment to financial scores, based on pay received in 2010. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">The threshold amount is the amount that would have been payable had the minimum score been achieved. Target is the amount payable had the business and individual
performance scores been 100% on all metrics. The maximum amount reflects the highest amount payable for maximum scoring on all metrics. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">(3)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">The number of units presented in Columns&nbsp;(f),&nbsp;(g)&nbsp;and&nbsp;(h) represents PSUs for the 2010-2012 performance cycle. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">Each PSU represents the value of one share of our Common Stock. The number of PSUs earned for the 2010-2012 performance cycle will depend upon achievement against the
following metrics: three-year relative TSR versus the financial peer group (50% of the target award); three-year compound annual growth in adjusted earnings per share-diluted measured against an internal target (12.5% of the target award); and
annual growth in adjusted earnings per share-diluted measured against an internal target for each year of the three-year performance cycle (12.5% of the target award per year). Payment, if any, for awards will be made in shares of the Company&#146;s
Common Stock at the conclusion of the three-year performance cycle. The Committee will approve the targets for the annual adjusted earnings per share-diluted metrics at the beginning of each of the three years in the performance cycle. The minimum
award as shown in Column&nbsp;(f)&nbsp;is the number of shares payable for achievement of the threshold level of performance on one of the metrics and the maximum award as shown in Column&nbsp;(h) is the number of shares payable at achievement of
the maximum level of performance on all metrics. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">More information regarding PSUs and the 2010 awards can be found in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis and the Outstanding Equity Awards table.
</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">66 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">(4)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">None of the named executive officers received other stock awards in 2010, therefore no amounts are shown in Column&nbsp;(i). </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">(5)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">The number of options awarded to each named executive officer on February&nbsp;23,&nbsp;2010 was calculated as one-half of the executive&#146;s long-term incentive
target percentage times his or her 2010 base salary divided by the Black-Scholes value of $6.84 for each option. The Black-Scholes value is based on the $39.26 exercise price for these options determined as the closing price of the Company&#146;s
Common Stock on the award date, February&nbsp;23,&nbsp;2010. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">All options awarded by the Company have a ten-year term, subject to earlier expiration in the event of termination of employment, and vest in 25% increments over four
years, subject to acceleration in the event of a change in control of the Company and continued vesting in the event of retirement, death or disability. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">More information regarding stock options and the 2010 award can be found in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis and the Outstanding Equity Awards table below.
</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">(6)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">This column presents the exercise price for each option award based upon the closing price of the Company&#146;s Common Stock on the New York Stock Exchange on the
award date shown in Column&nbsp;(b). </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">Column&nbsp;(l)&nbsp;presents the aggregate grant date fair value of the target number of PSUs reported in Column&nbsp;(g) and the stock options reported in
Column&nbsp;(j) as determined in accordance with Financial Accounting Standards Board Accounting Standards Codification Topic 718. The assumptions used in determining these amounts are set forth in Note&nbsp;17 to the Company&#146;s Consolidated
Financial Statements included in our 2010 Annual Report to Stockholders that accompanies this proxy statement. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">(1)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">Columns&nbsp;(b) through&nbsp;(f) present information about stock options awarded to each named executive officer under the Incentive Plan. Each option
vests as to 25% of the shares on each of the first four anniversaries of the grant date, </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">68 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">
subject to earlier vesting in the event of a change in control. Generally, upon termination of employment, vested options must be exercised and unvested options are cancelled, except in the case
of retirement, death, or disability in which case the options continue to vest as scheduled and may be exercised for up to five years after termination of employment. If termination occurs within two years after a change in control for any reason
other than for Cause or by the executive without Good Reason as defined in the EBPP 3A, vested options may be exercised for one year after termination. If an executive officer is under age 55 and his or her employment is terminated for reasons other
than for Cause or for Good Reason, the executive will be eligible to exercise all vested stock options and a prorated portion of his or her unvested stock options held on the date of separation from service for a period of 120 days following
separation. No option may be exercised after its expiration date. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">(2)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">Options listed in Column&nbsp;(b) are vested and may be exercised by the executive at any time subject to the terms of the stock option. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">(3)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">Options listed in Column&nbsp;(c) had not vested as of December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2010. The following table provides information with respect to the dates on which these
options are scheduled to vest, subject to continued employment (or retirement, death or disability), prorating in the event of severance, and to acceleration in the event of a change in control. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

Column&nbsp;(i) is the maximum number of PSUs awarded for the 2009-2011 performance cycle. Based on progress to date against goals, amounts presented in Column&nbsp;(i) for the 2010-2012 performance cycle are at maximum, which is 250% of target, and
amounts presented in Column&nbsp;(i) for the 2009-2011 performance cycle are at maximum, which is 250% of target. The actual number of PSUs earned, if any, will be determined at the end of each performance cycle and may be less than the amount
reflected in Column&nbsp;(i). </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

the New York Stock Exchange on December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2010. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">69 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><A NAME="toc144369_20"></A>Option Exercises and Stock Vested </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The following table and explanatory footnotes provide information with regard to amounts paid to or received by our named executive officers during 2010
as a result of the exercise of stock options or the vesting of stock awards. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Option Exercises and Stock Vested
</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>2010 </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="20%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="1%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="19%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="1%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="19%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="1%"></TD>

market value at the time of exercise of the shares purchased less the exercise price paid. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">(2)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">With the exception of Ms.&nbsp;Binder, the values shown in Column&nbsp;(d) include the number of PSUs from the 2008-2010 performance cycle that ended on
December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2010 that were determined by the Committee, or by the independent members of our Board in the case of Mr.&nbsp;West, to be earned. The results of the 2008-2010 performance cycle, that ended December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2010,
exceeded the maximum financial targets established at the start of the performance cycle. The awards included in Column&nbsp;(d) reflect payment at the maximum award level, 250% of target. These PSUs were paid in February&nbsp;2011. In accordance
with the PSU award, each PSU represents one share of our Common Stock valued in Column&nbsp;(e) at $47.15, the closing price of our Common Stock on the New York Stock Exchange on December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2010. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">For Messrs. Alfonso and Bilbrey, Ms.&nbsp;Binder and Mr.&nbsp;Snyder, Column&nbsp;(d) also includes the number of RSUs that vested in 2010 as a result of prior year
awards. These awards are described in more detail in the following footnotes. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">(3)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">On May&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2010, 2,635&nbsp;RSUs awarded to Mr.&nbsp;Alfonso in 2007 vested. Mr.&nbsp;Alfonso elected to defer 100% of this award. On the vesting date of these
RSUs, Mr.&nbsp;Alfonso received a cash payment of $9,394, equivalent to dividends that would have been earned on these RSUs had he held Common Stock instead of RSUs during the vesting period. Mr.&nbsp;Alfonso utilized the net cash received in lieu
of dividends on the RSUs designated for deferral to meet tax obligations on the deferred portion of his award, resulting in deferral of all 2,635&nbsp;shares. Based on Mr.&nbsp;Alfonso&#146;s deferral election, these 2,635&nbsp;RSUs were paid as
shares of Common Stock, net of applicable taxes, in January&nbsp;2011. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">On September&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2010, 500&nbsp;RSUs awarded to Mr.&nbsp;Alfonso in 2006 vested. Mr.&nbsp;Alfonso elected to defer 75% of this award payment
and receive immediate payment in shares of the Company&#146;s Common Stock for the remaining 25%. On the vesting date of these RSUs, Mr.&nbsp;Alfonso received a cash payment of $2,373, equivalent to dividends that would have been earned on these
RSUs had he held Common Stock instead of RSUs during the vesting period. Mr.&nbsp;Alfonso utilized the net cash received in lieu of dividends on the RSUs designated for deferral to meet tax obligations on the deferred portion of his award, resulting
in deferral of 375&nbsp;shares. Based on Mr.&nbsp;Alfonso&#146;s deferral election, these 375&nbsp;RSUs will be paid as shares of Common Stock, net of applicable taxes in 2012. Mr.&nbsp;Alfonso utilized the remaining net cash received in lieu of
dividends on the RSUs designated for deferral along with the net cash received in lieu of </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">70 </FONT></P>

<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">(4)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">On March&nbsp;17,&nbsp;2010, 625&nbsp;RSUs awarded to Mr.&nbsp;Bilbrey in 2009 vested. Mr.&nbsp;Bilbrey elected to defer 100% of this award. On the vesting date of
these RSUs, Mr.&nbsp;Bilbrey received a cash payment of $944, equivalent to dividends that would have been earned on these RSUs had he held Common Stock instead of RSUs during the vesting period. Mr.&nbsp;Bilbrey utilized the net cash received in
lieu of dividends on the RSUs designated for deferral to meet tax obligations on the deferred portion of his award, resulting in deferral of all 625&nbsp;shares. Based on Mr.&nbsp;Bilbrey&#146;s deferral election, these 625&nbsp;RSUs will be paid as
shares of Common Stock, net of applicable taxes, upon his separation from service from the Company, subject to the requirements of section 409A of the Internal Revenue Code. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">On June&nbsp;3,&nbsp;2010, 3,750&nbsp;RSUs awarded to Mr.&nbsp;Bilbrey in 2008 vested. Mr.&nbsp;Bilbrey elected to receive immediate payment in shares of the
Company&#146;s Common Stock. In addition, Mr.&nbsp;Bilbrey received a cash payment of $9,094, equivalent to dividends that would have been earned on these RSUs had he held Common Stock instead of RSUs during the vesting period. Mr.&nbsp;Bilbrey
utilized the net cash received in lieu of dividends on the RSUs and liquidated 1,437&nbsp;RSUs to meet tax obligations, resulting in his receipt of 2,313&nbsp;shares of the Company&#146;s Common Stock. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

Incentive Plan. Required tax withholdings were deducted from all payments. Column&nbsp;(e) reflects the value of the 4,375&nbsp;shares realized by Mr.&nbsp;Bilbrey as the result of vesting of RSUs in 2010 and the cash equivalent of dividends payable
on the RSUs vesting in 2010. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">(5)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">On March&nbsp;24,&nbsp;2010, 5,500&nbsp;RSUs awarded to Ms.&nbsp;Binder in 2008 vested. Ms.&nbsp;Binder elected to defer 100% of this award. On the vesting date of
these RSUs, Ms.&nbsp;Binder received a cash payment of $13,214, equivalent to dividends that would have been earned on these RSUs had she held Common Stock instead of RSUs during the vesting period. Ms.&nbsp;Binder utilized the net cash received in
lieu of dividends on the RSUs designated for deferral to meet tax obligations on the deferred portion of her award, resulting in deferral of all 5,500&nbsp;shares. Based on Ms.&nbsp;Binder&#146;s deferral election, these 5,500&nbsp;RSUs were paid as
shares of Common Stock, net of applicable taxes, in January&nbsp;2011. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">(6)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">On December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2010, 5,000&nbsp;RSUs awarded to Mr.&nbsp;Snyder in 2008 vested. Mr.&nbsp;Snyder elected to receive immediate payment in shares of the
Company&#146;s Common Stock. In addition, Mr.&nbsp;Snyder received a cash payment of $15,325, equivalent to dividends that would have been earned on these RSUs had he held Common Stock instead of RSUs during the vesting period. Mr.&nbsp;Snyder
utilized the net cash received in lieu of dividends on the RSUs and liquidated 1,585&nbsp;RSUs to meet tax obligations, resulting in his receipt of 3,415&nbsp;shares of the Company&#146;s Common Stock. The value of the RSUs paid to Mr.&nbsp;Snyder
was based on the closing price of the Company&#146;s Common Stock on the trading day prescribed by the Incentive Plan. Required tax withholdings were deducted from all payments. Column&nbsp;(e) reflects the market value of the 5,000&nbsp;shares on
the vesting date and the cash equivalent of dividends paid on the vesting date. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><A NAME="toc144369_21"></A>Pension Benefits
</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Each of the named executive officers, with the exception of Mr.&nbsp;O&#146;Day and Ms.&nbsp;Binder, is a participant in our
tax-qualified defined benefit pension plan and is fully vested in his benefit under that plan. Messrs.&nbsp;West, Bilbrey and Snyder were eligible to participate in our non-qualified defined benefit Supplemental Executive Retirement Plan, or
DB&nbsp;SERP. With the exception of Mr.&nbsp;West, whose eligibility for a DB&nbsp;SERP benefit is described below, no benefit is payable under the DB&nbsp;SERP if the executive officer terminates employment prior to age 55 or if he or she does not
have five years of service with the Company. As of December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2010, Mr.&nbsp;Snyder had attained age 55 with five years of service. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The combination of the tax-qualified and DB&nbsp;SERP plans was designed to provide a benefit on retirement at or after reaching age 60 based on a joint
and survivor annuity equal to 55% of final average compensation for an executive officer with 15 or more years of service (reduced pro rata for each year of service under 15). Effective January&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2007, the benefit payable under the
DB&nbsp;SERP to an executive officer who was age 50 or over as of January&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2007 was reduced by 10%, and the benefit payable to an executive officer who had not attained age 50 as of
</FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">71 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">
January&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2007, was reduced by 20%. The benefits payable to Messrs.&nbsp;Bilbrey and Snyder were reduced by 10% and the benefit payable to Mr.&nbsp;West was reduced by 20%. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Final average compensation is calculated as the sum of (i)&nbsp;the average of the highest three calendar years of base salary paid over the last five
years of employment with the Company and (ii)&nbsp;the average of the highest three annual incentive program awards for the last five years of employment with the Company, whether received or deferred. The benefit accrued under the DB&nbsp;SERP is
payable upon retirement in a lump sum, a life annuity with 50% benefit continuation to the participant&#146;s surviving spouse, or payment may be deferred in accordance with the provisions of the Company&#146;s Deferred Compensation Plan. The lump
sum is equal to the actuarial present value of the joint and survivor pension earned, reduced by the lump sum value of the benefits to be paid under the tax-qualified defined benefit pension plan and the value of the executive&#146;s Social Security
benefits. If the executive officer terminates employment after age 55 but before age 60, the benefit is reduced for early retirement at a rate of 5%&nbsp;per year for the period until the executive would have turned 60. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Our employment agreement with Mr.&nbsp;West contains special provisions relating to the vesting of his benefit under the DB&nbsp;SERP. Under the
employment agreement, Mr.&nbsp;West was fully vested in his accrued DB&nbsp;SERP benefit as of January&nbsp;2,&nbsp;2008. If Mr.&nbsp;West terminates employment prior to age 60, the benefit payable upon termination is reduced for early retirement at
a rate of 5%&nbsp;per year for the period between termination and attainment of age 60. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The CLRP provides eligible participants the defined
benefit he or she would have earned under our tax-qualified defined benefit pension plan were it not for the legal limitation on compensation used to determine benefits. An executive officer who is a participant in DB&nbsp;SERP is not eligible to
participate in the CLRP, unless he or she (i)&nbsp;ceases to be designated by the Committee as eligible to participate in the DB&nbsp;SERP prior to his or her termination of employment with the Company, or (ii)&nbsp;has his or her employment
involuntarily terminated by the Company other than for Cause prior to vesting in the DB SERP. Such executive officer would then become eligible to participate in the CLRP and to receive a benefit for all years in which he or she would have been a
participant of the CLRP, but for his or her designation by the Committee to be eligible to participate in the DB&nbsp;SERP. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Executive
officers who are eligible for both the DC&nbsp;SERP (described under Non-Qualified Deferred Compensation below) and the tax-qualified defined benefit pension plan receive an additional credit under the CLRP equal to 3% of eligible earnings less the
IRS annual limitation on compensation. Mr.&nbsp;Alfonso is the only named executive officer eligible for the CLRP. Upon separation, benefits under the CLRP are payable in a single lump sum or may be deferred into the Deferred Compensation Plan. A
participant is eligible for his or her CLRP benefit upon separation from service (subject to the provisions of section 409A) after five years of service or attaining age 55 (unless the participant is terminated for Cause). Payment is also made to
the estate of a participant who dies prior to separation from service. Participants who become disabled are 100% vested in their benefit and continue to accrue additional benefits for up to two additional years. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">72 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>

accrued under the tax-qualified defined benefit pension plan, as applicable, and the DB&nbsp;SERP or CLRP for each named executive officer as of December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2010. The amounts shown for the DB&nbsp;SERP reflect the reduction for the
present value of the benefits under the tax-qualified defined benefit pension plan and Social Security benefits. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Pension

<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="center" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; padding-right:8px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#151;</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#e5e5e5">
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; padding-left:8px"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">J. P. Bilbrey</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Tax-Qualified Defined Benefit</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Pension Plan</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">73 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><A NAME="toc144369_22"></A>Non-Qualified Deferred Compensation </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Our named executive officers are eligible to participate in The Hershey Company Deferred Compensation Plan. The Deferred Compensation Plan is a
non-qualified plan that permits participants to defer receipt of compensation otherwise payable to them. The Deferred Compensation Plan is intended to secure the goodwill and loyalty of participants by enabling them to defer compensation when the
participants deem it to be beneficial to do so and by providing a vehicle for the Company to provide, on a non-qualified basis, contributions which could not be made on the participants&#146; behalf to the tax-qualified 401(k) Plan. The Company
credits the Deferred Compensation Plan with a specified percentage of compensation for executive officers participating in the non-qualified DC&nbsp;SERP. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Our named executive officers may elect to defer payments to be received as a result of DB&nbsp;SERP, CLRP, the One Hershey Incentive Program, PSU and RSU awards, but not stock options. Amounts deferred
are credited to the participant&#146;s account under the Deferred Compensation Plan. Amounts deferred are fully vested and will be paid at a future date or at termination of employment, as the participant may elect. DB&nbsp;SERP and CLRP payments
designated for deferral are not credited as earned, but are credited in full upon the participant&#146;s retirement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Payments are distributed
in a lump sum or in annual installments of up to 15 years. All amounts are payable in a lump sum following a change in control. All elections and payments under the Deferred Compensation Plan are subject to compliance with section 409A which may
limit elections and require a delay in payment of benefits in certain circumstances. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">While deferred, amounts are credited with
&#147;earnings&#148; as if they were invested as the participant elects in one or more investment options available under the Deferred Compensation Plan. The investment options under the Deferred Compensation Plan consist of investment in shares of
our Common Stock or in mutual funds or other investments available to participants in our 401(k) Plan. The participants&#146; accounts under the Deferred Compensation Plan will be adjusted daily, up or down, depending upon performance of the
investment options elected. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Effective January&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2007, we began crediting the deferred compensation accounts of all employees,
including the named executive officers, with the amount of employer matching contributions that exceed the limits established by the IRS for contribution to the 401(k) Plan. These amounts are credited in the first quarter of the year after they are
earned. As shown in the footnotes to the Summary Compensation Table beginning on page&nbsp;62, these amounts are designated as &#147;Supplemental 401(k) match&#148; and are included as &#147;All Other Compensation&#148; in the year earned. These
amounts also are included in Column&nbsp;(c) of the Non-Qualified Deferred Compensation table in the year earned. All of the named executive officers are fully vested in the Supplemental 401(k) match credits and will be paid at a future date or at
termination of employment, as elected by the officer. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Effective January&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2007, we began crediting the deferred compensation
accounts of all employees hired on or after January&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2007, including eligible named executive officers, with the amount of core retirement contributions that exceed the limits established by the IRS for contribution to the 401(k) Plan.
These amounts are credited in the first quarter of the year after they are earned. As shown in the footnotes to the Summary Compensation Table, these amounts are designated as &#147;Supplemental Core Retirement Contribution&#148; and are included as
&#147;All Other Compensation&#148; in the year earned. These amounts also are included in Column&nbsp;(c) of the Non-Qualified Deferred Compensation table in the year earned. As of December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2010, Mr.&nbsp;O&#146;Day was the only named
executive officer eligible for the Supplemental Core Retirement Contribution credit and he is fully vested in this benefit. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">74 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Messrs.&nbsp;Alfonso and O&#146;Day are eligible to participate in our DC&nbsp;SERP, a part of the Deferred
Compensation Plan. The DC&nbsp;SERP provides annual allocations to the Deferred Compensation Plan equal to a percentage of compensation determined by the Committee in its sole discretion. In order to receive the annual DC&nbsp;SERP allocation, an
executive officer must (i)&nbsp;defer in the 401(k) Plan the maximum amount allowed by the Company or IRS and (ii)&nbsp;be employed on the last day of the plan year unless he or she terminates employment while at least age 55, retires, dies or
becomes disabled. After completing five years of service with the Company, an executive officer is vested in 10% increments based on his or her age. An executive age&nbsp;46 with five years of service is 10% vested and an executive age 55 with five
years of service is 100% vested. Mr.&nbsp;Alfonso&#146;s and Mr.&nbsp;O&#146;Day&#146;s annual DC&nbsp;SERP allocation is equal to 12.5% of base salary and One Hershey Incentive Program award for the calendar year, whether paid or deferred.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The following table sets forth information relating to the activity in the Deferred Compensation Plan accounts of the named executive
officers during 2010 and the aggregate balance of the accounts as of December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2010. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Non-Qualified Deferred
Compensation </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>2010 </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;<FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP ALIGN="center" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000">
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><B>Aggregate<BR>Earnings&nbsp;in</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT

award that vested September&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2010. Mr.&nbsp;Alfonso utilized the net cash received in lieu of dividends on the RSUs designated for deferral to meet the tax obligations on these two deferred awards. The value of Mr.&nbsp;Alfonso&#146;s
2007 and 2006&nbsp;RSU awards are not listed in the Summary Compensation Table of this proxy statement. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">
this column also reflects the DC&nbsp;SERP contribution earned in 2010. These amounts are included in Column&nbsp;(i) of the Summary Compensation Table of this proxy statement.
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

chosen by the officer. Amounts reported in Column&nbsp;(d) were not required to be reported as compensation in our Summary Compensation Table. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="center" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #000000; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000; padding-right:8px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;47,260</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><A NAME="toc144369_23"></A>Potential Payments Upon Termination or Change in Control </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">We have entered into an employment agreement with Mr.&nbsp;West and maintain plans covering our executive officers that will require us to provide incremental compensation in the event of involuntary
termination of employment or a change in control. We describe these obligations below. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Overview </I></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">We entered into an employment agreement with Mr.&nbsp;West at the time of his promotion to the position of President in October&nbsp;2007. The agreement
has a term of three years and renews daily. The agreement provides for Mr.&nbsp;West&#146;s employment as our President and effective December&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2007 as President and Chief Executive Officer and contains provisions relating to his
responsibilities, compensation, confidentiality, non-competition and non-solicitation commitments and agreements, and payments, if any, to be made to him upon termination of employment. Mr.&nbsp;West and our other named executive officers
participate in the EBPP&nbsp;3A. The EBPP&nbsp;3A is intended to help us attract and retain qualified executive employees and maintain a stable work environment by making a provision for the protection of covered executives in connection with a
change in control of Hershey or termination of employment under certain circumstances. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Each of our named executive officers was required to
sign an Executive Confidentiality and Restrictive Covenant Agreement, or ECRCA, as a condition to receiving long-term incentive compensation awards such as stock options and PSUs. The ECRCA obligates the executive officer to not disclose or misuse
our confidential and proprietary information or, for a period of 12 months following termination, carry on any activities that compete with our business. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Termination of employment and a change in control also impact PSUs, RSUs and stock option awards we have made, as well as benefits payable under our employee benefit plans. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">76 </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The following narrative takes each termination of employment situation &#150; voluntary resignation,
discharge for Cause, death, disability, discharge without Cause, and resignation for Good Reason&nbsp;&#150; and a change in control of the Company, and describes the additional amounts, if any, that the Company would pay or provide to
Messrs.&nbsp;West, Alfonso, Bilbrey, O&#146;Day and Snyder, or their beneficiaries as a result. The narrative below and the amounts shown reflect certain assumptions we have made in accordance with SEC rules. These assumptions are that the
termination of employment or change in control occurred on December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2010 and that the value of a share of our Common Stock on that day was $47.15, the closing price on the New York Stock Exchange on December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2010. This
narrative does not include information on benefits the Company would pay or provide to Ms.&nbsp;Binder as she was no longer an employee of the Company on December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2010. We describe the commitment under the agreement entered into with
Ms.&nbsp;Binder at the end of this section. In addition, the amounts shown below do not reflect changes we have implemented to the EBPP&nbsp;3A which became effective on February&nbsp;22,&nbsp;2011 as described on page&nbsp;60. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In addition, in keeping with SEC rules, the following narrative and amounts do not include payments and benefits which are not enhanced by the
termination of employment or change in control. These payments and benefits include: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>

<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Benefits accrued under the Company&#146;s broad-based tax-qualified 401(k) Plan and tax-qualified defined benefit pension plan;
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:2px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:2px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
